Calculates centroid size

Calculates centroid size

coo_centsize(coo)

Arguments

coo

matrix of (x; y) coordinates or any Coo object.

Value

numeric, the centroid size.

Details

This function can be used to integrate size - if meaningful - to Coo objects. See also coo_length and rescale.

See also

Other centroid functions: coo_centdist, coo_centpos

Examples

coo_centsize(bot[1])
#> [1] 334.5633
# on a Coo
coo_centsize(bot)
#>         brahma          caney         chimay         corona    deusventrue 
#>       334.5633       306.7108       219.8902       244.5173       277.2225 
#>          duvel   franziskaner     grimbergen        guiness     hoegardeen 
#>       209.9113       266.9157       250.9776       239.5509       325.1174 
#>        jupiler     kingfisher       latrappe lindemanskriek    nicechouffe 
#>       298.3329       219.7530       263.6269       253.3830       213.4968 
#>     pecheresse   sierranevada     tanglefoot          tauro      westmalle 
#>       284.5338       216.5601       235.1876       298.9465       234.7873 
#>          amrut    ballantines      bushmills         chivas        dalmore 
#>       264.8661       247.5475       275.3402       267.5940       234.1056 
#>   famousgrouse    glendronach   glenmorangie   highlandpark    jackdaniels 
#>       189.1846       252.2914       302.1172       239.5193       256.3820 
#>             jb  johnniewalker       magallan     makersmark           oban 
#>       314.3681       105.8965       224.6436       278.0914       260.6653 
#>     oldpotrero      redbreast         tamdhu     wildturkey         yoichi 
#>       194.3786       141.1566       311.2793       347.3127       234.4413 
# add it to $fac
mutate(bot, size=coo_centsize(bot))
#> An Out object with: 
#>  - $coo: 40 outlines (162 +/- 21 coordinates, all unclosed)
#>  - $fac: 2 classifiers:
#>      'type' (factor 2): beer, whisky.
#>      'size' (numeric): mean: 253, sd: 48.6.
